purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: A self-service app for employees to browse and request devices, which integrates with Azure AD for user data and uses Dataverse for data storage.

app_screens.screen_details: Allows users to browse available devices, view specs, photos, and availability, and filter by department-approved models.
Form for selecting a device, justifying business need, selecting urgency level, and auto-populating employee name/department from Azure AD.
A screen to confirm the order details before submission, ensuring all information is correct.

mvp_components.flow_details: Automated workflow for managers to receive notifications and approve or reject device order requests with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

flow_actions.action_details: Notify managers when a new order request is submitted.
Allow managers to approve or reject the request with an option to add comments.

post_mvp_modules.details: Employees can view the status of their requests, with email notifications at each step. An optional Power BI dashboard for tracking is available for procurement.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Canvas App with a Power BI dashboard to provide employees and procurement with detailed tracking capabilities.

post_mvp_modules.details: IT Administrators can update stock levels and mark orders as fulfilled. Integration with procurement systems like SAP is required.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Add a new screen to the Canvas App for IT Administrators to manage inventory and integrate with SAP for procurement data.

technical_scope: Use Device Ordering System Canvas App
Use Approval Workflow in Power Automate

constraints: Must use Power Apps Canvas App
Data must be stored in Dataverse
Approval process must use Power Automate
Device models filtered by department policy
App must support desktop + mobile usage
No external users (internal only via Azure AD)
integration_points: Power Automate for approvals and notifications
Procurement system (e.g., SAP) for inventory management
notes: The design must be clean and corporate with a responsive layout for phone and desktop. It should include dropdowns, cards, and status icons, and confirm the order screen before submission. The design must also be accessible (WCAG AA).
